case_vignette: A 38-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of progressive headache, blurry vision, and nausea for 1 day. Four days ago, she was diagnosed with a right middle ear infection. She appears lethargic. Her temperature is 39.1°C (102.3°F), and blood pressure is 148/95 mm Hg. Ophthalmologic examination shows bilateral swelling of the optic disc. The corneal reflex in the right eye is absent. Sensation to touch is reduced on the upper right side of the face. Serum studies show increased concentrations of fibrin degradation products.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a progressive headache, blurry vision, and nausea for the past day.
How old are you?
I am 38 years old.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications?
Four days ago, I was diagnosed with a right middle ear infection.

Understood. Thank you for the information. I am now going to provide a diagnosis.
**Final Diagnosis:** Migraine with Aura
